section: C."MANDATORY PRODUCTS" shall mean the following ADAMS GOLF PRODUCTS that CONSULTANT must exclusively play/use in all Champions/Senior Professional Golf Association (SPGA) and Professional Golf Association (PGA) events at all times. However, ADAMS GOLF acknowledges that from time to time, CONSULTANT may, at his discretion, utilize products from other manufacturers if ADAMS GOLF's products are deemed unsuitable or unavailable for a specific tournament or event. [***** ] Confidential Material redacted and filed separately with the Commission. 2 1.[*****] 2.Sufficient [*****] to maintain total minimum of [*****] ADAMS GOLF [*****] (includes [*****])[*****] at all times 3.[*****] 4.[*****] (CONSULTANT may continue to place the [*****] logo on the [*****] consistent with historical practice.)
explanation: The definition of "MANDATORY PRODUCTS" is ambiguous and contradictory. It states that the Consultant *must* exclusively use Adams Golf products but then allows for the use of other manufacturers' products if Adams Golf's products are "deemed unsuitable or unavailable." This creates a contradiction because the term "mandatory" implies no exceptions, while the added clause provides a broad exception based on the Consultant's discretion. The redacted sections further obscure the specific requirements, making it difficult to determine what constitutes a "mandatory" product.

section: C."MANDATORY PRODUCTS" shall mean the following ADAMS GOLF PRODUCTS that CONSULTANT must exclusively play/use in all Champions/Senior Professional Golf Association (SPGA) and Professional Golf Association (PGA) events at all times. However, ADAMS GOLF acknowledges that from time to time, CONSULTANT may, at his discretion, utilize products from other manufacturers if ADAMS GOLF's products are deemed unsuitable or unavailable for a specific tournament or event. [***** ] Confidential Material redacted and filed separately with the Commission. 2 1.[*****] 2.Sufficient [*****] to maintain total minimum of [*****] ADAMS GOLF [*****] (includes [*****])[*****] at all times 3.[*****] 4.[*****] (CONSULTANT may continue to place the [*****] logo on the [*****] consistent with historical practice.)
explanation: The redacted sections within the definition of "MANDATORY PRODUCTS" create an omission in the text.  The contract refers to specific ADAMS GOLF products that are 'mandatory,' but these products are not clearly defined within the visible text. The omission of this key information undermines the enforceability of the clause requiring exclusive use of mandatory products, as the reader cannot ascertain which products are subject to this requirement and leads to confusion about what the obligations of the consultant are under this contract.

section: A. In each and every calendar year of this Agreement, CONSULTANT shall endeavor to achieve a satisfactory record of play in a minimum of [* ****] professional golf association events on the SPGA and/or PGA tour (which shall include both the PGA and SPGA Tour Skins Games). If for any reason, CONSULTANT should achieve a satisfactory record of play in less than [*****] SPGA and/or PGA tour events in a calendar year, he *may*, at ADAMS GOLF's sole discretion, be required to repay ADAMS GOLF an amount per event for each event under [*****] achieved in the given calendar year as follows: The agreed upon repayment amount per event per calendar year: 1. Year 1. $[*****] 2. Year 2 $[*****] 3. Year 3 $[*****] 4. Year 4 $[*****] 5. Year 5 $[*****] B. If repayment is deemed necessary by ADAMS GOLF, payment shall be made to ADAMS GOLF within one month following notification of the required repayment.
explanation: The phrase "satisfactory record of play" is ambiguous and leads to multiple interpretations. It is never explained what 'satisfactory record of play' means, so that there is no way to enforce this clause, and it is up to ADAMS GOLF to interpret what this means.

section: A. In each and every calendar year of this Agreement, CONSULTANT shall endeavor to achieve a satisfactory record of play in a minimum of [* ****] professional golf association events on the SPGA and/or PGA tour (which shall include both the PGA and SPGA Tour Skins Games). If for any reason, CONSULTANT should achieve a satisfactory record of play in less than [*****] SPGA and/or PGA tour events in a calendar year, he *may*, at ADAMS GOLF's sole discretion, be required to repay ADAMS GOLF an amount per event for each event under [*****] achieved in the given calendar year as follows: The agreed upon repayment amount per event per calendar year: 1. Year 1. $[*****] 2. Year 2 $[*****] 3. Year 3 $[*****] 4. Year 4 $[*****] 5. Year 5 $[*****] B. If repayment is deemed necessary by ADAMS GOLF, payment shall be made to ADAMS GOLF within one month following notification of the required repayment.
explanation: The text uses "may" when discussing the repayment. Using "may" to describe the potential for repayment by the consultant makes it an option instead of a requirement if ADAMS GOLF decides it is necessary. This creates a contradiction and makes it difficult to enforce under state or national law.

section: For the entire term of this Agreement, from September 1, 2004 through [*****] ADAMS GOLF *intends* to pay CONSULTANT a base compensation of [*****] dollars. Payment of the base compensation will be subject to ADAMS GOLF's financial performance and continued evaluation of CONSULTANT's brand value.
explanation: The word "intends" creates ambiguity regarding the base compensation. The contract states that ADAMS GOLF *intends* to pay the consultant, which means that they might not be legally obligated to pay CONSULTANT. Additionally, payment is subject to ADAMS GOLF's financial performance and their continued evaluation of CONSULTANT's brand value. This introduces further uncertainty and subjectivity, as these factors are not clearly defined or measurable.

section: For the entire term of this Agreement, from September 1, 2004 through [*****] ADAMS GOLF *intends* to pay CONSULTANT a base compensation of [*****] dollars. Payment of the base compensation will be subject to ADAMS GOLF's financial performance and continued evaluation of CONSULTANT's brand value.
explanation: The term 'base compensation' is misaligned in text. The term is used without clearly defining what the base compensation actually is. The value is redacted, so there is no way to know the value of the base compensation.
